name: Oxybutynin Chloride
indications: oxybutynin chloride tablets indicated relief symptoms bladder instability associated voiding patients uninhibited neurogenic reflex neurogenic bladder ( i.e . , urgency , frequency , urinary leakage , urge incontinence , dysuria ) .
warningsAndPrecautions: oxybutynin chloride tablets usp , 5 mg , round , light blue , scored tablets debossed `` 4853 `` `` v `` one side separated horizontal score plain reverse side . tablets supplied follows : unit dose packages 100 ( 10 x 10 ) ndc 60687-670-01 store 20° 25°c ( 68° 77°f ) [ usp controlled room temperature ] . protection : blister torn broken .
adverseReactions: oxybutynin chloride contraindicated patients urinary retention , gastric retention severe decreased gastrointestinal motility conditions , uncontrolled narrow-angle glaucoma patients risk conditions . oxybutynin chloride also contraindicated patients demonstrated hypersensitivity substance components product .
indications_original: Oxybutynin chloride tablets are indicated for the relief of symptoms of bladder instability associated with voiding in patients with uninhibited neurogenic or reflex neurogenic bladder (i.e., urgency, frequency, urinary leakage, urge incontinence, dysuria).
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Oxybutynin Chloride Tablets USP, 5 mg, are round, light blue, scored tablets debossed "4853" and "V" on one side separated by a horizontal score and plain on the reverse side. The tablets are supplied as follows:
  
Unit dose packages of 100 (10 x 10) NDC 60687-670-01
 
                  Store at 20° to 25°C (68° to 77°F) [see USP Controlled Room Temperature].
                  
                     FOR YOUR PROTECTION: Do not use if blister is torn or broken.
adverseReactions_original:
Oxybutynin chloride is contraindicated in patients with urinary retention, gastric retention and other severe decreased gastrointestinal motility conditions, uncontrolled narrow-angle glaucoma and in patients who are at risk for these conditions.
                  Oxybutynin chloride is also contraindicated in patients who have demonstrated hypersensitivity to the drug substance or other components of the product.
